data.title: Metta World Peace, Basketball Player
data.meta_description: Metta World Peace stats and bio. Stats averages season by season. Quick access to game by game stats.
data.text:
Metta World Peace - Points

Metta World Peace scores a career high 39 points (2007)

On January 02, 2007, Metta World Peace tied his career high in points in a NBA game. That day he scored 39 points in Sacramento's home win against New York, 112-100. He also had 8 rebounds, 2 assists, 5 steals and 1 block. He shot 12/17 from two, 3/5 from three, shooting at 68.2% from the field. He also shot 6/6 from the free-throw line.

Metta World Peace - Rebounds

Metta World Peace grabs a career high 16 rebounds (2012)

On December 16, 2012, Metta World Peace set his career high in rebounds in a NBA game. That day he grabbed 16 rebounds in LA Lakers's road win against Philadelphia, 98-111. He also had 19 points, 1 assist, 4 steals and 2 blocks.

Metta World Peace - Assists

Metta World Peace gives a career high 11 assists (2007)

On December 08, 2007, Metta World Peace set his career high in assists in a NBA game. That day he dished 11 assists in Sacramento's road loss against Denver, 101-97. He also had 10 points, 2 rebounds, 5 steals.

Metta World Peace - Steals

Metta World Peace has a career high 8 steals (2001)

On February 24, 2001, Metta World Peace tied his career high in steals in a NBA game. That day he reached 8 steals in Chicago's home win against Vancouver, 90-75. He also had 19 points, 6 rebounds and 7 assists.

Metta World Peace - Blocks

Metta World Peace blocks a career high 4 shots (2003)

On November 28, 2003, Metta World Peace tied his career high in blocks in a NBA game. That day he went for 4 blocks in Indiana's home win against Philadelphia, 90-77. He also had 20 points, 7 rebounds and 8 assists.

Metta World Peace - Efficiency

Metta World Peace records a career high 47 efficiency rating (2007)

On January 02, 2007, Metta World Peace set his career high in efficiency in a NBA game. That day he accomplished 47 efficiency in Sacramento's home win against New York, 112-100. He also had 39 points, 8 rebounds and 2 assists.
